text:
Note: If you have an Apple mobile device or viewing this on Safari, the 360 video will look best when viewed through the YouTube App.

Kendall Jenner’s street style has been particularly exciting to watch in the last year. Between her penchant for retro fanny packs and her obsession with statement shoes (thigh-highs, transparent booties—you name it, she’s tried it!), the supermodel has a healthy appetite for the most tricky-to-pull-off trends; in fact, she’s been responsible for setting a few of them in motion. It certainly makes the prospect of peeking inside her closet—with Google Daydream’s 360-degree technology, no less—even more intriguing. The supermodel has not one but two wardrobes inside her apartment in Los Angeles, and invited Vogue in for the grand tour earlier this summer.

The first closet, a traditional walk-in, is packed to the rafters with weird and wonderful fashion treasures: Think 7-inch Alaïa stompers given to her by her brother-in-law, Kanye West; the Birkin bag she uses as a carry-on; the hilarious novelty-print onesies that the Kardashian-Jenners like to wear every year during the holidays. More of a fitting room than a closet, the second space is where all the fun happens, where Jenner puts together her most daring and unexpected outfits; there’s even a colorful mood board of fashion inspiration. Here you’ll find trophy pieces of the coolest kind, including those bubblegum pink Balenciaga legging boots; the teeniest, tiniest Louis Vuitton bags; and rare vintage Vivienne Westwood finds. Then, of course, there are all those priceless archive looks—remember the chain-mail dress Jenner wore on her 21st birthday, or that body-skimming number on the Met Gala red carpet last year? See Jenner unpack those fashion memories, while scanning every nook and cranny of her space, in the 360-degree video, above.
title: Experience Kendall Jenner’s Closet in 360 Degrees
